Package jcurses.widgets

Class FileDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • jcurses.widgets.Window
      • jcurses.widgets.Dialog
        • jcurses.widgets.FileDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, ItemListener, WindowListener, WidgetsConstants

    public class FileDialog
extends Dialog
implements WidgetsConstants, ItemListener, ActionListener
    This class implements a file select dialog

      • setIOErrorMessageText

        public void setIOErrorMessageText​(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the text of the message, that is shown, if an i/o error is occured while the dialog tries to open a directory
        Parameters:

      • setIOErrorMessageTitle

        public void setIOErrorMessageTitle​(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the title of the message, that is shown, if an i/o error is occured while the dialog tries to open a directory
        Parameters:
        message - i/o error message's text

      • directoryReadErrorMessage

        protected void directoryReadErrorMessage​()
        Shows the i/o error message, if an i/o occcurs reading a directory. In the default implementation uses texts set with setIOErrorMessageTitle and setIOErrorMessageText. can be modified in derived classes.

      • setDefaultFile

        public void setDefaultFile​(java.lang.String file)
        Sets the default selected file
        Parameters:
        file - default selected file, if null, no file is selected per default.

      • getDefaultFile

        public java.lang.String getDefaultFile​()
        Returns:
        default selected file

      • getChoosedFile

        public java.io.File getChoosedFile​()
        Returns the last selected file. Should be called after a return from the show method to read the result. If null is returned, no file was selected.
        Returns:
        selected file

      • setFilterString

        public void setFilterString​(java.lang.String filterString)
        Sets a filter string Sets a string used to filter the files, that are shown in selected directories. The filter string can be also modified by user. The filter string has to be in the form *, and matches all files, whose names start with and end with . Both and can be empty.
        Parameters:
        filterString - filter string

      • getFilterString

        public java.lang.String getFilterString​()
        Returns:
        filter string

      • setFilterFactory

        public void setFilterFactory​(JCursesFileFilterFactory filterFactory)

      • onChar

        protected void onChar​(InputChar inp)
        Description copied from class: Window
